place.name: LOWER SHUCKBURGH
place.gazetteerText: SHUCKBURGH (Lower and Upper), two parishes in Southam district, Warwick; 5 and 4½ miles W of Daventry r. station. Post town, Daventry. Acres, 870 and 910. Real property, £1,902 and £2,075. Pop., 152 and 60. Houses, 34 and 11. The manors, with S. Hall, belong to Sir F. Shuckburgh, Bart. The livings are united p. curacies in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £30. Patron, Sir F. Shuckburgh, Bart. The church was rebuilt in 1846. There is a free school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
